security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate knowledge base management tool with filesystem operations scoped to the project-local docs/knowledge directory. Imports exec from child_process but never uses it. No network calls, no credential access, and behavior matches stated purpose.

content.user_title: Build Structured Knowledge Base from Code
content.value_statement: Teams struggle to capture and share domain knowledge. This skill extracts concepts from code, creates structured documentation, and builds an organized knowledge base with markdown files.
actual_capabilities: Scan code to extract domain concepts (classes, interfaces, types)
limitations: Operates only on local project files in docs/knowledge directory
Does not sync with external documentation systems
No collaboration or version control features

use_cases.title: Document Domain Concepts
use_cases.description: Extract technical terms from code and create a shared vocabulary for the team

use_cases.title: Generate Structure Guides
use_cases.description: Build how-to guides and best practices with standardized templates

use_cases.title: Record Architecture Decisions
use_cases.description: Document why technical choices were made for future reference

prompt_templates.title: Initialize Knowledge Base
prompt_templates.prompt: Run init to set up docs/knowledge structure with concepts, guides, decisions, and external directories

prompt_templates.title: Scan Code for Concepts
prompt_templates.prompt: Run scan to analyze code and generate a list of concepts that should be documented

prompt_templates.title: Discover Documentation Gaps
prompt_templates.prompt: Run discover to analyze project structure and generate documentation checklist

output_examples.input: Run scan to analyze my codebase
output: Found 15 concepts to document: UserAuthentication, SessionManager, PaymentProcessor, OrderService, InventorySystem, ShippingCalculator, TaxEngine, NotificationService, CacheManager, DatabaseConnection, APIGateway, RateLimiter, ErrorHandler, Logger, ConfigurationManager
Scan complete. Suggestions saved to: docs/knowledge/suggested_concepts.md

best_practices: Run discover before creating documents to see project structure and suggested topics
Document the 'why' not just the 'what' using decision records
anti_patterns: Skipping the common misconceptions section in concept documents
Creating deep nested categories beyond 5 levels
Using inconsistent naming conventions across documentation

faq.question: What file types does scan support?
faq.answer: TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, and Rust files. Limited to 50 files per scan for performance.

faq.question: How deep can category hierarchies go?
faq.answer: The tool supports unlimited nesting but recommends keeping categories under 5 levels deep.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing documentation?
faq.answer: Yes. The init command only creates missing directories. Existing files in docs/knowledge are preserved.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All operations are local. The skill reads and writes only to your project's docs/knowledge directory.

faq.question: Why is my concept marked as existing?
faq.answer: The scan checks for matching filenames in docs/knowledge/concepts. Ensure document names match the concept name.

faq.question: How is this different from regular documentation?
faq.answer: This tool focuses on capturing tacit knowledge and domain concepts, not just API documentation. It uses structured templates with anti-patterns and cognitive alignment sections.
